definitions.definition: From side to side, often in an oblique manner ; across or over .
examples: Above, the stars appeared to move slowly athwart .
We placed one log on the ground, and another athwart , forming a crude cross.

definitions.definition: Across the path of something, so as to impede progress .
examples: a fleet standing athwart our course

definitions.definition: Against the anticipated or appropriate course of something; improperly , perversely , wrongly .

main_definition: From side to side, often in an oblique manner ; across or over .
secondary_definitions: Across the path of something, so as to impede progress .
( figuratively ) Against the anticipated or appropriate course of something; improperly , perversely , wrongly .
